文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk1
证据片段: Zircaloy-2 having several different microstructures, textures, and compositions has been bombarded with either $5 \ \mathbf { M e V }$ or $4 6 . 5 \ \mathrm { \bf ~ M e V }$ nickel ions at 300 to $6 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ to achieve doses ranging from 0.65 to 87.0 displacements per atom (dpa)

证据片段: Zircaloy-2 having several different microstructures, textures, and compositions has been bombarded with either $5 \ \mathbf { M e V }$ or $4 6 . 5 \ \mathrm { \bf ~ M e V }$ nickel ions at 300 to $6 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ to achieve doses ranging from 0.65 to 87.0 displacements per atom (dpa)

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk1
证据片段: Similar material was reactor-irradiated near $3 2 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ to neutron fluences between 0.8 and 3.2 dpa

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk1
证据片段: For doses below 10 dpa $( 8 \times 1 0 ^ { 2 } )$ neutrons $( { \mathsf { n } } ) / { \mathsf { c m } } ^ { 2 }$ $\mathbf { E } { > } 1 ~ \mathbf { M e V } ) _ { . }$ and temperatures below $4 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ , the predominant defects formed by nickel ion bombardment are black spots and loops on the order of 100 $\mathsf { l } 0 \ \mathsf { n m } )$ diameter

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk1
证据片段: At temperatures above $4 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ , the residual microstructure appears to depend on the rate of displacement damage

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk1

证据片段: The nominal composition was (by weight): 1.5 percent tin, 0.15 percent iron, 0.11 percent chromium, 0.06 percent nickel, 120 ppm carbon, 4 ppm hydrogen, 48 ppm nitrogen, and 1000 to 1500 ppm oxygen

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk3
证据片段: Even for a displacement damage level as high as 87 dpa, which corresponds to the equivalent of about 7×10²² n/cm² E>1 MeV, no evidence for the existence of voids was obtained

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk3
证据片段: Material A contains primarily black spots of a size near 100 Å diameter after neutron irradiation at 327°C to 0.8 dpa (6.4×10²⁰ n/cm² E>1 MeV)

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk3
证据片段: Irradiation to higher fluences, 3.2 dpa (2.6×10²¹ n/cm² E>1 MeV) for Material F, does not appear to significantly change the size or number of defects present

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk3
证据片段: crystal bar zirconium, Material L, contains a substantial number of resolvable loops of size near 300 Å (30 nm) diameter

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk3
证据片段: Short rows consisting of 4 to 7 loops have been observed

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk3
证据片段: Corduroy contrast can be eliminated by post-irradiation annealing for 1 h at 450 or 500°C

证据片段: Corduroy contrast can be eliminated by post-irradiation annealing for 1 h at 450 or 500°C

证据片段: A very weak corduroy image was observed as an isolated case in only one ion bombarded specimen (Material E bombarded at 300°C)

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk5
证据片段: For doses below 10 dpa, equivalent to about $8 \times 1 0 ^ { 2 1 } ~ \mathrm { { n / c m } ^ { 2 } }$ $| \textbf { E } > ~ 1$ MeV), and temperatures below $4 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$ , the predominant defects formed by nickel ion bombardment are black spots and small loops on the order of 100 A $( 1 0 \ \mathrm { n m } )$ diameter.

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk5
证据片段: The microstructure induced by ion bombardment is only slightly dependent on irradiation temperature between 300 and $4 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk5
证据片段: For dose rates near $2 . 5 \times 1 0 ^ { - 4 } ~ \mathrm { d p a } / s$ there is very little residual damage after bombardment at $5 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk5
证据片段: At $1 . 7 \times 1 0 ^ { - 2 } { \bf d p a } / s$ , damage remains at $5 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ but is annealed in situ for $6 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$ bombardments

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk5
证据片段: At $1 . 7 \times 1 0 ^ { - 2 } { \bf d p a } / s$ , damage remains at $5 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ but is annealed in situ for $6 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$ bombardments

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk5
证据片段: A hitherto unreported diffraction contrast phenomenon has been observed in neutron irradiated zirconium and Zircaloy. This "corduroy" effect generally does not occur in nickel-bombarded material.

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk5
证据片段: For doses above about 10 dpa and irradiation temperatures of 400 to $5 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$ , bombardment with $5 \mathbf { M e V }$ nickel ions produces a striking alignment of "defects" in {0002} planes.

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk5
证据片段: For doses above about 10 dpa and irradiation temperatures of 400 to $5 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$ , bombardment with $5 \mathbf { M e V }$ nickel ions produces a striking alignment of "defects" in {0002} planes.

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk5
证据片段: Oxygen content varying between 180 to 1500 ppm (weight) does not appear to affect the defect structure for either nickel or neutron irradiation.

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_022_chunk5
证据片段: Irradiation-induced voids were not observed.
